repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. Alun Jones papers
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. Alun Jones was a financial executive at JWT's Toronto and New York offices during the 1960s-1970s, holding the positions of Secretary-Treasurer and Executive Vice-President; he was elected to JWT's Board of Directors in 1974. The Alun Jones Papers cover the years 1930-1984, with the bulk of the collection dating from the late 1970s, and contains files primarily relating to Jones's work as a financial executive and administrator at the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT). The collection consists of memoranda, correspondence, and reports covering topics including audits, agency compensation, management incentive plans and other company policies, and files related to financial matters at JWT's offices including Chicago, Detroit, New York and San Francisco, as well as JWT's international offices including Australia, Canada, and South Africa. Clients represented include Burger King, Kodak, Kraft, and Lever Brothers (Unilever). Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alun Jones Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Alun Jones Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1987.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession is described in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Chronology List

eventgrp.event: Account Supervisor, J. Walter Thompson Limited (Canada)
Senior Vice President and Director of Finance and Administration, JWT Canada
Senior Vice President, Business Management, JWT New York
Senior Vice President-Finance, JWT New York
Executive Vice President-Finance; elected to Board of Directors of JWT

bioghist.p: Alun Jones was born in Wales and was educated at Magdalen College School in England. He was an Associate of the Chartered Institute of Secretaries.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Alun Jones Papers cover the years 1930-1984, with the bulk of the collection dating from the late 1970s, and contains files primarily relating to Jones's work as a financial executive and administrator at the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT). The collection consists of memoranda, correspondence, and reports covering topics including audits, agency compensation, management incentive plans and other company policies, and files related to financial matters at JWT's offices including Chicago, Detroit, New York and San Francisco, as well as JWT's international offices including Australia, Canada, and South Africa. Clients represented include Burger King, Kodak, Kraft, and Lever Brothers (Unilever).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains general files of memoranda, correspondence, and reports covering such topics as audits, agency compensation, the management incentive plan, and other company policies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by topic. Original folder titles were maintained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains memoranda, correspondence, and reports related to JWT's international offices in Amsterdam, Argentina, Australia, Brazil, Canada, Chile, France, Germany, India, Japan, Puerto Rico, South Africa, and the United Kingdom.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically. Original folder titles were maintained.
